messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Re: This list---again
messages.msgSnippet: Kathryn & Julian - I m so excited to hear this!  I make wire jewelry, and have been wanting to incorporate some chainmail techniques.  I ll be there ...
messages.messageBody:
Kathryn & Julian - I'm so excited to hear this! I make wire jewelry, and
have been wanting to incorporate some chainmail techniques. I'll be there
:0). ~Rue

>>>It looks like Julian and I will be at the conference, and Julian will be
leading a Funshop on making Chain mail.
Kathryn

messages.subject: Re: Re: This list---again
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/20/2003 10:47:49 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... It looks like Julian and I will be at the conference, and Julian will be leading a Funshop
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/20/2003 10:47:49 PM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

> << Jonathan,ds, is interested in learning how to do chailmail. We have a
> friend who's going to show him. I think it will be fun for both of us. >>
>
> If you go to google and look up chainmail patterns or instruction or
> chainmail making, you will find some WONDERFUL stuff and he won't totally
> have to wait for his friend to get going (at least mentally).
>
> You can also buy rings pre-cut which will help some. Keith made a full
> mail
> coat out of coat hangers, twisting and cutting every ring, and it's too
> heavy
> at that gauge.
>

It looks like Julian and I will be at the conference, and Julian will be
leading a Funshop on making Chain mail.
Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
